Police: Stabbings in Boston stemmed from court case

Four people were stabbed in a busy section of downtown Boston today, including one person who suffered life-threatening injuries, police said. (Boston Globe)

Dow Jones has its best day of the year

The 286-point gain turned the index positive for 2012 and erased a 275-point plunge on Friday. (AP)

Teen to serve year for fatal texting crash

Aaron Deveau was convicted for causing a fatal crash by texting while driving. He was ordered to serve a year, with the rest of his sentence suspended. (Boston Globe)
  • Families react to sentencing of teen in texting crash

UMass board approves 4.9% fee hike

The increase, which affects all undergraduates and most graduate students, would raise the fees for in-state undergraduates by about $580. (Boston Globe)
  • video Governor Patrick comments on the proposal

Black bear spotted in Provincetown

The black bear that has been bumbling through backyards and cranberry bogs for over a week on Cape Cod has popped up once again. (Boston Globe)

Big Dig pavement
crumbles early

Sections of the Central Artery that were supposed to last 30 years are failing in less than a decade, causing a rash of potholes and debris.

Obama winning among small donors

As of the end of April, 43 percent of the donors who contributed to the Obama campaign gave $200 or less, generating a total of $88.5 million.
Opinion | Bob Ryan

Heat coach in tough spot vs. Celtics

The beleaguered Erik Spoelstra can only dream that one day he will be coaching a true team like, well, like the one wearing green and white.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

All of Boston should vote on casino

If a Suffolk Downs casino is win-win for the city, why can’t all of Boston vote?

Triple Crown dream time again

On Saturday, I'll Have Another will be the latest horse to try to win racing's biggest prize.
Opinion | Yvonne Abraham

Sweet deal for soda

Massachusetts is one of only 12 states in the country that essentially subsidize soda, forgoing sales taxes to make it cheaper than it should be.

The new service is an improvement over the on-screen channel guide we’ve been using for years, but the effort to empower viewers is a work in progress.

Diamond Jubilee
